featured.text: People who learned a second language later in life used a special part of Broca’s area for their second language—near the one activated for their native tongue.
New Zealanders have given it the nickname , which is a native Maori word meaning “god of bad looks.”
Often considered as representing the circle of life, hoops featured prominently in the ritual dances of Native Americans.
He could not say the name of his native town, Catano.

Since rats love to hunt and eat wetas, the rat population on the island has its grown into a real problem for many of the native species that are unaccustomed to presence, and poses a serious threat to the native weta population.

other.text: Natives planted the fruit across South and Central America and in the Caribbean region, 23 Christopher Columbus first found it.
The native greeted the travelers in a language which was strange to them.
Still others think that most aliens visit Earth to study us like our scientists study primitive natives and animals, and have no interest in helping us __(40)__.
Who wrote the book about Native Americans’ view of death? (A) Bruce Brooks.

definition.zh_def: 本地的；土生土長的；原住民的
definition.en_def: Belonging to a particular place by birth or origin.
definition.example: She is a native of Canada and speaks both English and French.
